QUESTION:
HTML:
<p>I've recently download <code>poi-src-3.2-FINAL</code> from apache.org.  Now I can't write these:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>import org.apache.poi.poifs.filesystem.*;&#xA;import org.apache.poi.hwpf.*;&#xA;import org.apache.poi.hwpf.extractor.*;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Now I can't use the classes of <code>HWPFDocument</code> and <code>WordExtractor</code>.  I can only</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>import org.apache.*;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Did I forget to download any other thing?</p>&#xA;
Comment:

ACCEPTED ANS:

ANS:
HTML:
<p>"src" usually indicates a package containing <em>only</em> the source code, not the compiled classes. Check to see if there is a "bin" download available for you.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Update: the binary release is indeed named poi-<strong>bin</strong>-3.2-FINAL, <a href="http://www.signal42.com/mirrors/apache/poi/release/bin/poi-bin-3.2-FINAL-20081019.zip" rel="nofollow">here is a download link</a>.</p>&#xA;
Comment:

Phrase:
apache.org 
download CODE0 from apache.org 
've recently download CODE0 from apache.org 
write these 
ca n't write these 
use the classes of CODE0 and CODE1 
ca n't use the classes of CODE0 and CODE1 
can only 
download any other thing 
to download any other thing 
forget to download any other thing 
containing only 
usually indicates a package containing only 
is a `` bin '' download available for you 
see if there is a `` bin '' download available for you 
to see if there is a `` bin '' download available for you 
Check to see if there is a `` bin '' download available for you 
named poi-bin-3 .2 
is indeed named poi-bin-3 .2 
is a download link
